newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian court orders British postman murder trial.
newsitem.headline: Australian court orders British postman murder trial.

text.p: A young Australian man accused of killing a British tourist at Sydney's famous Bondi beach was on Thursday committed to stand trial for murder.

Aaron Martin, 23, is said by the prosecution to have inflicted a savage beating on London postman Brian Hagland last September in a fit of drunken rage. Martin told a local Sydney court on Thursday that he was not guilty.
Another man, Sean Cushman, is to stand trial charged with being an accessory after the fact of murder.

Hagland, 28, was run over by a bus after his clash with Martin. The Sydney court heard during a two-week committal hearing that it was unclear whether or not Hagland was pushed into the vehicle and to what extent the collision was responsible for his death.
Hagland's fiancee Connie Casey, who was with him at the time of the assault, walked out of Thursday's hearing in tears.
Both Martin and Cushman were granted bail. Because of a backlog of cases in the New South Wales state supreme court, it could be almost two years before a jury considers Martin's case.
